sentences.en: By bringing me hither, to die this death of triumphant ignominy before the people!
sentences.cn: 他把我带到这里,让我在众人面前, 死在胜利的耻辱之中!

sentences.en: Despite ignominy of Watergate, President Nixon still wins praise for building bridges to China.
sentences.cn: 虽然有水门事件的污点, 但尼克松仍因建立美中外交关系而受到赞扬.

sentences.en: Gradually his feeling of ignominy and of rage sank.
sentences.cn: 他的怒火和委屈渐渐烟消云散.

sentences.en: He can certainly try to find solution to cover his appearance, hides this kind of ignominy.
sentences.cn: 他一定会想办法遮盖住他的样子, 把这种丑行藏起来的.

sentences.en: Her sin, her ignominy, were the roots which she had struck into the soil.
sentences.cn: 她的罪孽, 她的耻辱, 便是她深扎于此地的根.

sentences.en: If they were caught, she would be thrown out in disgrace, dismissed with ignominy.
sentences.cn: 一旦他们被抓住，她就会名誉扫地，被很不光彩地撤职开除。
蒙羞的人都渴望别人的尊重.

sentences.en: The index also reflects fears that other large funds will suffer the same ignominy as Bear's.
sentences.cn: 指数同时反应了人们对贝尔登斯旗下这样的大型基金也将无法幸免的担心.

sentences.en: They suffered the ignominy of defeat.
sentences.cn: 他们蒙受了失败的耻辱。

sentences.en: Was she now to endure the ignominy of his abandoning her?
sentences.cn: 她现在是否准备忍受被他抛弃的痛苦?

sentences.en: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
sentences.cn: 箴18:3恶人来 、 藐视随来.羞耻到 、 辱骂同到.

trans.tran_en: an event or situation that makes you feel ashamed or embarrassed, especially in public
